summary: Olive E. Wagner was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCA). She is mentioned in payroll and certification reports from April 1978 to December 1978. These documents list her as an employee, along with her salary and pay during those periods. The documents do not specify her exact role within the committee, but her presence on the payroll indicates she was a staff member.
significance: Olive E. Wagner's significance lies in her employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations. While the specific nature of her work is not detailed in these documents, her presence on the payroll provides a record of individuals involved in the committee's operations during its investigation into the JFK assassination.
